headline: Is Palo Alto Networks (PANW) Pricing Look Attractive After Recent Pullback And DCF Upside?
summary: If you are wondering whether Palo Alto Networks is reasonably priced or if you might be overpaying for growth, this article walks through the numbers so you can judge the value for yourself. The stock last closed at US$165.30, with returns of a 0.9% decline over 7 days, a 12.5% decline over 30 days, a 7.8% decline year to date, a 16.0% decline over 1 year, and gains of 86.5% over 3 years and 150.8% over 5 years. headline: Palo Alto plans dual listing in Tel Aviv after closing $25 billion CyberArk deal
summary: Shares of Nasdaq-listed Palo Alto Networks will also trade on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange, the ‌cybersecurity firm said on Thursday, after it closed its $25 billion purchase ‌of Israeli peer CyberArk Software. Following the dual listing, Palo Alto will be the largest company ​by market capitalization on the TASE, given that it is currently valued at $115 billion. The company, however, did not disclose the listing date.

The company, however, did not disclose the listing date.
